title: Metaplanet Issues $13 Million In Bonds For Additional Bitcoin Purchases
body: Metaplanet is going all in on BTC again — this time with a $13 million war chest. The Japanese Bitcoin treasury company has issued 2 billion Japanese yen ($13.3 million) in zero-interest bonds to continue expanding its BTC reserves. Metaplanet Issues More Debt To Buy More BTC On March 31, Metaplanet announced the fresh issuance of 0% ordinary bonds by allocation to fuel its Bitcoin purchases following a meeting of its board of directors. The debt security will be allocated via the company’s Evo fund, allowing investors to redeem the bonds at full face value by Sept. 30. Metaplanet CEO Simon Gerovich said in an X post that his firm was taking advantage of the recent pullback in crypto prices. The announcement comes as Bitcoin traded hands for around $83,797 at publication time, down 23.2% from its January historic high of nearly $109,000. Metaplanet is currently the tenth-largest corporate holder of Bitcoin in the world, with a stockpile of 3,350 BTC. Earlier this month, the Tokyo-listed company scooped up 150 Bitcoin , chipping away at its ambitious goal of accumulating 10,000 BTC by 2025 and 21,000 BTC by 2026 . Continuing An Aggressive Bitcoin Purchase Streak Meanwhile, Metaplanet is making powerful friends in the United States. Earlier in March, the firm added Eric Trump, son of U.S. President Donald Trump, to its newly established advisory board to bolster its mission to become a “global leader in the Bitcoin economy”. The latest debt offering signals Metaplanet’s intent to double down on a treasury strategy that’s rapidly gaining popularity among public companies, from GameStop’s $1.3 billion convertible note plan to other notable players like Semler Scientific and Bitcoin mining giant MARA holdings . The strategy was popularized by Michael Saylor’s software firm Strategy (formerly known as MicroStrategy), which has turned bold Bitcoin accumulation into a corporate identity. Strategy is the top corporate Bitcoin holder, with 528,185 BTC in its coffers, worth over $43 billion, or more than 2% of the 21 million Bitcoin supply limit.

title: 'Dire consequences' if Musk accesses SEC — US lawmaker
body: The top Democrat on the US House Financial Services Committee issued a warning after reports suggested that Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s “government efficiency” team would be given access to data and systems at the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). In a March 31 notice, Representative Maxine Waters reiterated a warning from a letter she sent to acting SEC Chair Mark Uyeda in February in response to the Musk-led Department of Government Efficiency’s reported access to sensitive SEC information. DOGE is an advisory body to US President Donald Trump rather than an official department established by Congress. According to the California lawmaker, giving Musk such access would have “dire consequences” for US investors and present conflicts of interest. “[...] as a result of this takeover, the agency is at greater risk of data breaches and market disruptions, both of which could result in investors, including retirees, losing their hard-earning savings,” said Waters, adding: “Not only that, Musk, who has been the subject of repeated SEC enforcement actions for breaking securities laws and regulations, can benefit his own businesses and harm his competitors by using his access to confidential business information and his influence over the agency’s operations.” Waters’ warning followed multiple reports suggesting that Musk’s DOGE team contacted the SEC and would be given access to the commission’s systems and data. Since joining the Trump administration as a “special government employee,” Musk has spearheaded efforts to fire staff at multiple government agencies, including the US Agency for International Development (USAID) and the watchdog Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB). Many of DOGE’s actions face lawsuits in federal court from parties alleging the group’s actions were illegal or unconstitutional. Related: Can the law keep up with Musk and DOGE? As one of the major US financial regulators, the SEC is responsible for oversight and regulation of many aspects of the cryptocurrency industry, including whether many tokens qualify as securities. Under Uyeda and US President Donald Trump, the commission has dropped several lawsuits alleging violations of securities laws against crypto firms since January. ‘Cost-cutting’ strategy at SEC? It’s unclear whether the DOGE team intends to “purge” the SEC of employees Musk considers not loyal to the Trump administration, as has been implied in some lawsuits involving firings at other government agencies. Cointelegraph contacted acting chair Uyeda and SEC Commissioner Caroline Crenshaw for comment but did not receive a response by the time of publication. DOGE’s reported infiltration of the SEC comes as the US Senate Banking Committee is expected to vote on whether to advance the nomination of Paul Atkins, Trump’s pick to chair the agency. At his March 27 confirmation hearing, Atkins said he would “definitely” be willing to work with DOGE if confirmed. Democratic lawmakers at the hearing questioned Atkins’ potential conflicts of interest with the crypto industry. Magazine: SEC’s U-turn on crypto leaves key questions unanswered

title: Bitcoin Headed Below $60K Says Hot-Handed Crypto Hedge Fund Manager
body: Bitcoin’s correction may just be getting started. In fact, the crypto sector as a whole could be facing a severe downtrend reminiscent of 2022. “I could see us going back to a five handle by the end of the year,” Quinn Thompson, founder of crypto hedge fund Lekker Capital, told CoinDesk in an interview. A "five handle," i.e. a price between $50,000 and $59,999, would be down substantially from the already shaky current $83,000 level and roughly a 50% decline from bitcoin's peak just above $109,000 just more than two months ago. “I don't think it happens quickly, which is why it would be very painful and shocking to people because nothing about the current market conditions is very volatile, with big liquidations and crashes,” Thompson added. “It's this sort of different market environment, a slow grind down that is almost more unbearable for people because they're like, ‘Is it over? Is the bottom in?’” Thompson, who had been bearish from far higher levels, has repeatedly called the White House’s crypto announcements — be it the Sovereign Wealth Fund or Strategic Bitcoin Reserve, or anything in-between — "nothingburgers" and “sell the news” events. He has also argued that Strategy’s (MSTR) constant bitcoin buys aren’t necessarily bullish for the cryptocurrency, since they seem to be the only significant bid. The economy’s four headwinds Central to Thompson’s thesis is the idea that the Trump administration’s various policies will likely hurt the economy for the next six to nine months. First, the Department of Government Efficiency (D.O.G.E), in its efforts to reduce the U.S. deficit, is bent on cutting government spending — which has been one of the largest drivers of job growth in recent years. The labour market was already wobbly when the Biden team handed over the reins to Trump, Thompson said, and the new government’s fiscal arm isn’t interested in propping things up anymore. “People get caught up in the politics of it,” Thompson said. “We can disagree on whether we need the Department of Education or not. But those dollars were being printed and going into people's pockets, and those people spent them, and went on vacation and to the grocery store. So it was growth positive.” Elon Musk, the main force behind D.O.G.E, said last week that he was aiming to cut $1 trillion in government spending by the end of May; he also said he wanted to cut 15% of the government’s annual spending, meaning almost $7 trillion. Even if D.O.G.E fails its stated objective and only manages to cut, say, a hundred billion over the course of four years, the bigger cuts are likely to occur at the beginning of Trump’s term, not the end, Thompson argued. This means that D.O.G.E’s impact on the economy and consumer sentiment is likely to be felt in the coming months, no matter whether the agency actually succeeds or not. Second, the crackdown on illegal immigration at the southern border — combined with the renewed emphasis on deportations — is bound to affect the labour market, Thompson said. Migration is growth positive because it puts pressure on wages; if that labour pool dries up, workers will demand higher salaries, which some businesses won’t be able to afford. Thompson’s third issue is tariffs. The Trump administration keeps changing up its tariff threats on a day-to-day basis, sometimes promising new ones, sometimes calling them off, creating doubt as to whether the majority of proposed tariffs will actually ever go into effect. But the important thing about tariffs is that they create uncertainty for businesses, which may elect to delay investment or hiring decisions until the tariff situation is resolved. Finally, the Federal Reserve doesn’t seem to be in a hurry to loosen financial conditions because inflation data hasn’t been great. The U.S. central bank cut interest by a full percentage point at the end of 2024, to 4.25%-4.5%, and even that wasn’t enough to push bitcoin above $110,000. Thompson says he expects the Fed to cut anywhere between 25 and 75 basis points in 2025, but that these cuts will be spread out in the second half of the year. “I think there's a lot more coordination going on between the Treasury and the Fed than people want to believe,” Thompson said. “People thought Trump and [Fed chair] Powell would be bickering, but they’re actually kind of on the same team right now. [Secretary of Treasury] Bessent and Trump are bringing growth down, and that helps Powell achieve lower inflation.” When will the bottom be? With such headwinds working against risk-on assets like stocks and bitcoin, the crypto sector is unlikely to have a good year, Thompson said. The fact that the White House doesn’t seem overly concerned about a potential recession is also a strong signal, he said. “Bessent is coming in saying, ‘We need to right the ship.’ And righting the ship means cutting off the juice that was powering these crazy asset prices. The direct result of their policies working is a lower stock market,” Thompson said. But how long is Trump likely to maintain course? Until it becomes too painful and even Trump’s political base tells him to cut it out, or until the beginning of 2026 — you can’t be pushing a country into a recession with midterm elections coming up. “I equate this to a controlled burn. They’re trying to purposefully clear the brush so that it doesn't become a bigger problem. But sometimes controlled burns become forest fires,” Thompson said. “I think it's going to be a long kind of slog through the year as they try to enact these policies.”

title: Unveiling Korean Crypto Trends: Top Searched & Mentioned Tokens Last Week
body: Want to know what’s hot in the South Korean crypto scene? If you’re keeping an eye on the pulse of the digital currency world, especially within the vibrant Korean crypto community, you’re in the right place. Last week, between March 21st and 27th, the Bitcoin World platform buzzed with activity, and we’ve got the inside scoop on the tokens that captured the most attention. Let’s dive into the captivating world of Korean crypto trends and see which digital assets reigned supreme in search and mentions! Top Searched Crypto Tokens in the K-Community: What Caught Korea’s Eye? Curiosity drives the crypto market, and search trends often foreshadow potential price movements or growing community interest. In the K-Community crypto space last week, certain tokens clearly piqued the interest of Korean crypto enthusiasts. Here’s a rundown of the top 10 most searched tokens: Rank Token Searches 1 XRP 70,896 2 AUCTION 22,746 3 ETH 21,429 4 BTC 19,060 5 SOL 14,863 6 MOVE 14,233 7 DOGE 13,616 8 PI 12,104 9 ORCA 12,001 10 LAYER 7,609 Key Takeaways from Top Searched Crypto: XRP Dominance: Wow! XRP takes the crown by a significant margin, boasting over 70,000 searches. This could indicate strong community sentiment, potential anticipation of news, or active trading interest surrounding XRP within the Korean market. AUCTION’s Surprising Surge: AUCTION, landing in the second spot, suggests a rising interest in this token within the K-Community. Is it related to specific project developments, partnerships, or perhaps a growing understanding of its utility? Blue Chips Still in the Game: Ethereum (ETH) and Bitcoin (BTC) maintain their positions in the top searches, proving their enduring relevance and consistent interest from Korean crypto users. They remain foundational pillars of the crypto market Korea is actively engaging with. Solana (SOL) Stays Strong: SOL’s presence in the top 5 indicates continued confidence in the Solana ecosystem and its potential. Korean investors are clearly keeping a close watch on its developments. Meme Coins and New Entrants: DOGE’s appearance reminds us of the meme coin phenomenon’s global reach, while tokens like MOVE, PI, ORCA, and LAYER signal potential emerging trends and projects capturing early attention. Top Mentioned Crypto Tokens: What’s the K-Community Talking About? Searches reveal curiosity, but mentions showcase genuine conversations and community engagement. Which tokens were the talk of the town in the K-Community crypto sphere? Let’s explore the top 10 mentioned tokens: Rank Token Mentions 1 BTC 1,341 2 ETH 667 3 AUCTION 466 4 SOL 402 5 XRP 366 6 TRUMP 237 7 ORCA 212 8 ONDO 157 9 DOGE 143 10 MOVE 117 Insights from Top Mentioned Crypto: Bitcoin & Ethereum Lead the Conversation: Unsurprisingly, Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH) dominate the mentions, reflecting their status as the foundational cryptocurrencies and ongoing discussions around their ecosystems, upgrades, and market movements. They are central to any discussion about the crypto market Korea follows. AUCTION’s Conversation Power: AUCTION again appears prominently, securing the third spot in mentions. This reinforces the idea that AUCTION is not just being searched, but actively discussed and debated within the K-Community. SOL and XRP Remain Relevant in Discussions: Solana (SOL) and XRP, while lower in mentions compared to searches, still hold significant conversational weight. This suggests a sustained level of interest and engagement beyond just initial curiosity. TRUMP Token Enters the Chat: The appearance of TRUMP token in the mentions is intriguing. This could be related to meme culture, political discussions intersecting with crypto, or speculative trading activity. It’s a unique element in the top mentioned crypto list. Emerging Tokens Continue to Generate Buzz: ORCA, ONDO, DOGE, and MOVE all find their place in the top mentions, indicating that these tokens are not just fleeting interests but are sparking ongoing conversations and community building. What Does This Mean for the Korean Crypto Market? Analyzing both search and mention data provides a nuanced view of the Korean crypto market . The high search volume for XRP coupled with its significant, though lower, mention count suggests strong underlying interest and perhaps a community waiting for specific catalysts or developments. AUCTION’s high ranking in both searches and mentions points to a potentially burgeoning trend worth watching closely. The consistent presence of BTC, ETH, and SOL reaffirms their foundational role in the Korean crypto landscape. The inclusion of tokens like TRUMP and meme coins highlights the diverse and dynamic nature of the K-Community’s interests. For those looking to understand the direction of the Korean crypto market, keeping an eye on these trends is crucial. Tracking search and mention data can offer valuable early signals of potential shifts in market sentiment and emerging opportunities. Are these trends fleeting, or do they signal a longer-term shift in Korean crypto preferences? Time will tell, but these insights provide a fascinating snapshot of the K-Community’s crypto focus right now. Stay Tuned for More Crypto Insights! The world of cryptocurrency is ever-evolving, and understanding community trends is key to navigating its complexities. By analyzing data like search and mention volumes, we can gain a clearer picture of market sentiment and potential future movements. Keep following Bitcoin World for more in-depth analyses and updates on the latest happenings in the crypto sphere! title: Circle Taps JPMorgan and Citigroup to Pursue IPO
body: Stablecoin issuer Circle Internet Financial has tapped top investment banks JPMorgan and Citigroup to proceed with its Initial Public Offering (IPO) plans. This marks significant progress towards the IPO’s success. Circle’s IPO Journey and Progress Circle has been working on going public for several years but has consistently faced roadblocks. Four years ago, the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) derailed its plans to pursue an SPAC merger, which used to be a popular route for companies seeking the attention of public markets. The most sought-after IPO is finally becoming a reality this April. According to some sources familiar with the matter, the new partnerships with JPMorgan Chase and Citigroup are focused on facilitating the IPO offering. The specific timeline has yet to be announced; however, trading is expected to commence within weeks after it is filed. Improved US Regulatory Shift May Favour Circle IPO The stablecoin issuer may need to extend this timeline if it meets a roadblock with regulators. However, the US regulatory landscape has improved since Donald Trump’s inauguration and Mark Uyeda’s appointment as interim SEC Chair. With favorable policies and regulatory frameworks, more crypto firms have seen the tides, including lawsuits with the SEC, turn in their favor. Should Circle succeed with this IPO, it would be the second in the digital asset sector after American cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase, which bagged its IPO in 2021. In a plot twist, JPMorgan Chase and Citi served as advisors in the Coinbase IPO. More Crypto Firms Plans For IPO Apart from Circle, several other digital asset services in the Web3 ecosystem providers seek an IPO equally. Three weeks ago, Gemini, the company Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss founded, confidentially filed for an IPO and enlisted Goldman Sachs and Citigroup to guide the process. Similarly, Singapore-based crypto mining rig manufacturer Bgin Blockchain Limited also filed an IPO in the US . This firm plans to raise $50 million by offering 59.54 million Class A ordinary shares and 15.69 million Class B shares, with an application to list them under the ticker “BGIN” on Nasdaq. Other firms speculated to be pursuing an IPO are Kraken, Bullish, and Blockchain.com. The post Circle Taps JPMorgan and Citigroup to Pursue IPO appeared first on TheCoinrise.com .

title: Unveiling the Transformative Alpha Quark Merger: HPP Token Set to Reshape DeFi
body: Get ready for a potentially seismic shift in the crypto landscape! The NFT marketplace Alpha Quark has dropped a bombshell governance proposal that could redefine its future and impact several other key players in the blockchain space. In a move that’s generating significant buzz, Alpha Quark is proposing a strategic merger to form the House Party Protocol (HPP) ecosystem. This isn’t just any merger; it’s a bold initiative to unite Alpha Quark with Aergo, W3DB (a project by VaaSBlock), and Booost under a single banner and a unified token: HPP. Let’s dive into the details of this exciting development and explore what it could mean for you. What is the Buzz About the Alpha Quark Merger and HPP Token? The core of this announcement revolves around a governance proposal posted on Alpha Quark’s official Medium blog. The proposal outlines a plan to create the House Party Protocol (HPP) through a strategic merger of four distinct projects. This isn’t just about combining forces; it’s about creating a synergistic ecosystem with a unified token economy. The key players involved in this potential Alpha Quark Merger are: Alpha Quark (AQT): An established NFT marketplace known for its focus on digital collectibles and unique user experiences. Aergo (AERGO): A public blockchain protocol designed for hybrid blockchain deployments, offering both public and private chain functionalities. W3DB: A project developed by VaaSBlock, although specific details require further clarification from official sources, it’s likely involved in data management or related blockchain infrastructure. Booost: Again, details are still emerging, but based on the context, it could be a platform or protocol that complements the functionalities of the other three, potentially in the DeFi or infrastructure space. The central piece of this merger is the introduction of the HPP Token . This unified token is proposed to consolidate the existing token economies of AQT, AERGO, W3DB, and Booost. If the proposal gets the green light, it will mean a token swap for current AQT holders. According to the announcement, the proposed swap ratio is 1 AQT for 7.43026 HPP. Why a Merger? Unpacking the Potential Benefits Mergers in the crypto world, like in traditional business, are often driven by the desire to achieve greater scale, synergy, and efficiency. What are the potential benefits of this Alpha Quark Merger to form HPP? Ecosystem Growth and Expansion: By combining the strengths of Alpha Quark, Aergo, W3DB, and Booost, the HPP ecosystem aims to become a more comprehensive and robust platform. This could lead to increased user adoption and greater network effects. Unified Token Economy with HPP Token: Consolidating multiple tokens into a single HPP Token can simplify the user experience, improve liquidity, and create a more cohesive economic model within the ecosystem. It can also streamline governance and incentivize participation across all merged platforms. Enhanced Interoperability: Aergo’s focus on hybrid blockchain solutions could provide a strong foundation for interoperability within the HPP ecosystem, potentially allowing for seamless interaction between different applications and services built on the platform. Technological Synergies: Combining the technological expertise of these four projects could lead to innovative solutions and faster development cycles. For instance, integrating W3DB’s data management capabilities with Alpha Quark’s NFT marketplace and Aergo’s blockchain infrastructure could create powerful new use cases. Stronger Market Position: A larger, more unified entity like HPP could have a stronger market presence and be better positioned to compete in the rapidly evolving crypto landscape. Governance Vote: Your Voice Matters Crucially, this is a governance proposal, meaning the community – specifically AQT token holders initially – will have a say in whether this Alpha Quark Merger goes ahead. The governance vote is scheduled to commence on April 2nd. This is a significant moment for the AQT community, as it will determine the future direction of the project and the value of their holdings. Here’s what you need to know about the voting process: Voting Platform: Details of the voting platform and process will likely be announced by Alpha Quark closer to April 2nd. Keep an eye on their official Medium blog and social media channels for updates. Token Holders’ Power: AQT token holders will be the ones voting on this proposal. The outcome of the vote will directly impact the future of AQT and its integration into the HPP ecosystem. Understanding the Proposal: It’s vital for AQT holders to thoroughly read and understand the full governance proposal on Alpha Quark’s Medium blog before casting their vote. Consider the potential benefits and risks before making a decision. Token Swap Details: What Happens to Your AQT? If the governance proposal passes, the next big question is: what happens to your AQT tokens? The proposal outlines a token swap mechanism. Here are the key details regarding the AQT to HPP Token swap: Swap Ratio: The proposed swap ratio is 1 AQT = 7.43026 HPP. This ratio is crucial for understanding the potential value of your AQT holdings post-merger. Swap Mechanism: The exact mechanism for the token swap will be detailed if the proposal is approved. It’s likely to involve a process where AQT holders can exchange their tokens for HPP tokens through a designated platform or smart contract. Timeline: The timeline for the token swap will also be announced post-governance vote approval. It’s important to stay informed about these timelines to ensure a smooth transition. Potential Value Implications: Token swaps can be complex and impact token value in various ways. Factors such as the perceived value of the HPP ecosystem, the demand for the HPP Token , and overall market conditions will influence the post-swap value of your holdings. Potential Challenges and Considerations While the proposed Alpha Quark Merger and the creation of the HPP ecosystem present exciting opportunities, it’s also important to acknowledge potential challenges and considerations: Integration Complexity: Merging multiple projects, especially those with different technologies and communities, can be complex. Successful integration will require careful planning and execution. Community Alignment: Ensuring alignment and buy-in from the communities of all four projects is crucial. Clear communication and addressing concerns from each community will be vital for a smooth transition. Execution Risks: As with any ambitious project, there are execution risks involved in implementing the merger and building the HPP ecosystem. Delays, technical challenges, or unforeseen market events could impact the success of the initiative. Information Gaps: Currently, information about W3DB and Booost is limited. More clarity on these projects and their roles within the HPP ecosystem is needed for a complete understanding of the merger’s potential. Market Volatility: The cryptocurrency market is inherently volatile. External market factors could influence the success of the merger and the value of the HPP Token . Actionable Insights: Staying Informed and Prepared For those interested in Alpha Quark, Aergo, or the broader implications of this merger, here are some actionable steps you can take: Read the Full Proposal: Head over to Alpha Quark’s official Medium blog and read the complete governance proposal. This is the best way to get a comprehensive understanding of the plan. Follow Official Channels: Stay updated by following Alpha Quark’s official Twitter, Telegram, and Medium channels for announcements and updates regarding the governance vote and the merger. DYOR (Do Your Own Research): Research Aergo, W3DB, and Booost to gain a better understanding of the projects involved in the merger. Look for official websites, whitepapers, and community discussions. Participate in Community Discussions: Engage in discussions within the Alpha Quark community and other relevant crypto communities to share your thoughts and learn from others. Prepare for the Governance Vote: If you are an AQT holder, prepare to participate in the governance vote starting April 2nd. Make an informed decision based on your understanding of the proposal and your investment goals. Conclusion: A Bold Move with Potential The proposed Alpha Quark Merger to form the House Party Protocol and introduce the HPP Token is undoubtedly a bold and potentially transformative move in the crypto space. It represents a significant step towards ecosystem consolidation and highlights the ongoing evolution of blockchain projects. While challenges and uncertainties remain, the potential synergies and benefits of uniting these four projects are undeniable. As the governance vote approaches, the crypto community will be watching closely to see if this ambitious vision becomes a reality. Keep your eyes peeled for updates and prepare to witness the next chapter in the Alpha Quark story, potentially as part of the exciting new HPP ecosystem. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Ethereum price action.

title: Unlucky Whale Gave Up On This Altcoin: Sold It All at Fifty Percent Loss
body: According to data from cryptocurrency onchain analysis firm Onchain Lens, a cryptocurrency whale transferred a large amount of altcoins to exchanges. The data revealed that the crypto whale in question transferred 427.79 million Pudgy Penguins (PENGU) tokens worth $2.48 million to Binance and OKX, losing $2.55 million in the process. In other words, this crypto whale lost more than 50% of his PENGU investment. Related News: Bitcoin (BTC) May Have Light at the End of the Tunnel - Here's What Analytics Company Claims This whale withdrew 441.83 million PENGU tokens from Binance, OKX, and Bybit approximately two months ago. Since then, he has only deposited 14.03 million PENGU, or $183,000 worth of tokens, into Binance. Onchain data shows that the crypto whale that made these transactions currently has around $1,500 in assets in his wallet. On the other hand, another large crypto wallet that funds this wallet (probably the same whale) has a portfolio worth $8 million. According to the data, a significant portion of this whale’s assets are in the Jupiter (JUP) token. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Unlucky Whale Gave Up On This Altcoin: Sold It All at Fifty Percent Loss

title: What are crypto wallets? The ultimate wallet guide for 2025
body: Crypto wallets enable you to send and receive cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ethereum by keeping your private keys, which are the passwords that grant you access to your funds, safe and easily accessible. Table of Contents What is a crypto wallet? Types of crypto wallets: Hot wallets vs cold wallets What is the best crypto wallet? What is the best crypto mobile wallet? Conclusion: Choosing the right crypto wallet for your needs Technically, a crypto wallet does not keep your cryptocurrency, in contrast to a regular wallet that can hold real cash. Although your holdings are live on the blockchain, only a private key can be used to access them. Your keys let you conduct transactions and serve as proof that you are the owner of your digital currency. In this article we will learn what a cryptocurrency wallet is, the difference between hot wallets vs cold wallets, and dive into some of the best crypto wallet apps out there. What is a crypto wallet? An application that serves as a wallet for your cryptocurrency is called a crypto wallet. Because it functions similarly to a wallet in which you store cash and credit cards, it is called a wallet. It provides the interface that enables you to access your cryptocurrency and stores the passkeys you use to sign for transactions, in place of these tangible objects. Everyone can access the blockchain thanks to contemporary blockchain wallets. Sending cryptocurrency was a laborious process that required entering lengthy keys when it was initially released. Nowadays, most of it is done for you by the software. Satoshi Nakamoto, the creator of Bitcoin ( BTC ), had the first wallet. Hal Finney, who supposedly ran the BTC client software wallet initially and corresponded with Nakamoto, owned the second wallet. The cryptocurrency frenzy started when Nakamoto sent him ten BTC as a test. Almost all crypto wallets have their dedicated cryptocurrency wallet app which users can use to store and withdraw crypto from online crypto exchanges. Now that we know what cryptocurrency wallets are, let’s dive into the key difference between a cold crypto wallet and a hot wallet. You might also like: The ultimate guide to the best crypto wallets for every trader Types of crypto wallets: Hot wallets vs cold wallets Hot and cold wallets are the two primary varieties of cryptocurrency wallets. Let’s discuss them one by one. What is a hot wallet? A third party hosts hot wallets, also known as online or custodial wallets, and keeps your keys on their behalf. These types of wallets might offer enterprise-level data security solutions that companies utilize to protect and preserve their data. Customers of certain crypto exchanges can access hot wallets. Applications for PCs and mobile devices are included in hot wallets. These wallets can access your cryptocurrency, conduct transactions, show your balance, and do a lot more. They can be installed on a desktop or laptop computer. If you’re using a wallet created by a cryptocurrency exchange, some software wallets can come with extra features like exchange integration. What is a cold wallet? Cold wallets or non-custodial wallets are ones where you are in charge of keeping your keys safe. The majority of crypto hardware wallets are cold wallets and considered a safer option than online wallets for obvious reasons. Since you can store and retrieve your private keys from your device, crypto cold wallets are the most widely used kind of wallet. These gadgets may seem like USB drives, and contemporary hardware wallets come with a number of functionalities. By connecting the hardware wallets for crypto to your computer or smartphone, you can conduct cryptocurrency transactions. The majority of them have the capacity to instantly sign cryptocurrency transactions without you having to enter the key, preventing hackers from recording your screen or logging your keystrokes. Now that we have identified the key differences between hot and cold wallets, let’s answer the most important question: what are the best wallets for cryptocurrency? What is the best crypto wallet? Since the inception of crypto wallets, hundreds of wallets have flooded the market and it can be difficult to identify the right one. We make it easy for you and here we list the top five cryptocurrency hardware wallets. 1. Trezor Trezor Safe 5 | Source: Trezor Trezor is a leader in hardware wallets, including devices such the Model One and Safe 5. These gadgets are well-liked by cryptocurrency aficionados because of their security, intuitive UI, and compatibility for a wide range of coins. Trezor lacks native staking and NFT administration, but it does include a touch screen for completely on-device entry and extremely safe offline storage. Additionally, it lacks a Bluetooth connection. Some of the best hardware for crypto storing is offered from Trezor. The Tezor Model One, its entry-level model, costs about $49, but it also offers a more costly variant with a touch screen (it cost $169 at the last update). Trezor offers built-in services like staking and cryptocurrency purchases through its software packages, but it also integrates with other cryptocurrency companies like Exodus. It offers both a desktop version and a mobile app (Trezor Suite Lite) for Android and Apple. You might also like: Trezor Safe devices still vulnerable to physical supply chain attacks, Ledger says 2. Exodus Exodus app + Trezor wallet | Source: Exodus Since its 2016 launch, Exodus , a non-custodial wallet that accepts several cryptocurrencies, including Bitcoin, has created a lot of excitement. It is a beautifully designed wallet that is full of features, including the ability to exchange cryptocurrencies within the wallet and the opportunity to stake assets directly within the wallet to generate passive income. Thousands of assets are supported by the Exodus wallet, and users can exchange over 100 supported digital currencies with their rapid exchange integration function, which keeps the coins safe and secure inside their own wallet. As a response to user requests for two-factor authentication and enhanced security, Exodus has partnered with and integrated with the Trezor hardware wallet, offering users the convenience, functionality, and user interface of the Exodus software wallet with the security and peace of mind of a hardware wallet. The Exodus wallet itself is accessible with a secure password, which should be adequate for the majority of users. 3. Ledger Ledger Nanox | Source: Ledger One of the most well-known brands in cryptocurrency wallets is Ledger . Ledger can interact with several well-known software wallets, including Crypto.com and Guarda, and its costs range from around $79 to $249. Ledger offers a separate desktop client, a browser plugin, and a well-reviewed mobile app. Additionally, Ledger offers two-factor authentication and a user education library. Over 5,500 assets can be supported by both Ledger wallet versions. They also give users access to decentralized finance programs, or dapps; however, non-fungible token, or NFT, management is no longer supported by the Nano Ledger S. With Ledger’s integrated desktop and mobile apps, you can buy, stake and swap currencies. Ledger Live software is open source, but the device firmware is not, and Ledger devices provide multisignature security with Coinkite integration and two-factor authentication. 4. SafePal S1 Hardware Wallet | Source: SafePal Established in 2018, SafePal provides both novices and seasoned cryptocurrency experts with a full range of safe crypto management solutions. Additionally, Binance Labs, Binance’s startup capital division, made its first hardware wallet investment with its S1 wallet. With its distinctive hardware wallets, software wallets, and browser extension wallet product lines, SafePal currently provides services to over seven million consumers worldwide. The SafePal app is used to pair and manage these, allowing users to conveniently store, manage, trade, and swap their assets. SafePal supports more than 100 blockchains (EVM and non-EVM) and 16 languages as of this writing, with more being added all the time. SafePal’s long-term goal is to enable investors to pursue financial independence and opportunity in the decentralized world. The S1 hardware wallet is going for $49.99 which is a decent price for a crypto hardware wallet with a digital interface and an acceptable amount of features as well. 5. KeepKey KeepKey hardware wallet | Source: KeepKey Since ShapeShift purchased KeepKey in 2017, its most popular product has been an offline wallet that helps keep your cryptocurrency safe from hackers. But KeepKey became an independent entity after ShapeShift became a DAO. ShapeShift and KeepKey, one of the numerous dApps that may be linked to the wallet, are still cooperating, though. Because KeepKey’s code is open-source, anyone may examine how the application is constructed, ensuring user safety and fostering confidence. Speaking about the wallet itself, K eepKey has significantly reduced its pricing when it was selling for $239 and now when it costs around $50, at the time of writing. What is the best crypto mobile wallet? While hardware wallets may be a safer option, they aren’t the most accessible, as most of them don’t have an online user-friendly interface. This is where hot wallets come to save the day, as all of them have an easy-to-use application which anyone can use to store and withdraw cryptocurrencies through their phone. Let’s dive right into some of the best ones. 1. Coinbase Wallet Coinbase mobile app | Source: Coinbase Coinbase, a well-known cryptocurrency exchange with headquarters in the US, created Coinbase Wallet, a self-custody cryptocurrency wallet. Coinbase Wallet offers consumers exclusive control over their funds and private keys, in contrast to the custodial wallets offered by exchanges. This decentralized wallet is intended for managing NFTs (non-fungible tokens), storing cryptocurrency, and communicating with decentralized apps (dApps). Numerous cryptocurrencies are supported by Coinbase Wallet, including well-known choices like BTC, Ethereum ( ETH ), Litecoin, and ERC-20 tokens. Additionally, it enables users to store NFTs on blockchains like Polygon and ETH. Users may transfer, receive, and manage cryptocurrency assets with ease because of the wallet’s user-friendly interface. Beginners are drawn to the simple interface, and more seasoned users are pleased by its powerful capabilities. Since the wallet employs non-custodial technology, the private keys are solely accessible by the user. These keys are kept locally on your device and are encrypted. Coinbase Wallet offers biometric verification, such fingerprint or face recognition, for further security, making it harder for unauthorized users to access your money. A 12-word recovery phrase is provided by Coinbase Wallet and has to be kept safe. In the event that your gadget is lost or hacked, this phrase is crucial to getting your wallet back. 2. Metamask Metamask mobile application | Source: consensys Popular and well-known, MetaMask is a browser extension that links to the Ethereum blockchain and serves as a cryptocurrency wallet. Without downloading the complete blockchain on their device, users can engage with the Ethereum ecosystem—which is home to an extensive collection of decentralized applications (Dapps)—by using MetaMask. As a result, it’s among the greatest Ethereum wallet options for convenient access to gaming platforms, gambling websites, decentralized exchanges (DEX), and numerous other apps. The most popular browsers, including Chrome, Firefox, Brave, and Microsoft Edge, are compatible with the wallet. In addition to ETH, the native currency of Ethereum, MetaMask also stores tokens based on the ERC-20 and ERC-721 specifications of the protocol. 3. Trust Wallet Trust Wallet mobile application | Source: Trust wallet For mobile users, Trust Wallet is a safe and open-source cryptocurrency wallet. It was purchased by Binance in 2018 and supports a wide range of blockchain networks and currencies, mostly based on Ethereum and other chains that are compatible with EVM. The wallet makes it easy for both new and experienced cryptocurrency users to transmit, receive, store, and stake their holdings. Trust Wallet provides high-security guarantees since private keys are kept locally rather than on a server. Its straightforward layout allows novices to use it, while professionals can access its more sophisticated capabilities. A single wallet can be used to manage a wide variety of tokens. The downsides include the lack of desktop interface, as users who prefer desktop interfaces will find it less accessible because it is a wallet designed primarily for mobile devices. Also, Trust Wallet, like the majority of mobile wallets, needs an online connection in order to conduct transactions as it’s not a hard wallet as discussed before in this article. 4. Phantom Wallet Phantom Android app | Source: Phantom Phantom is a browser plugin and non-custodial wallet that can connect with digital apps and smart contracts as well as manage digital assets. Non-custodial means that you retain possession of a few pieces of confidential information, rather than having your assets in a central repository. Similar to how you must protect your physical wallet or purse from pickpockets when you’re out and about, you are responsible for keeping the assets in your Phantom wallet safe, unlike when you keep your nation’s currency in a bank account. Avoid asking for assistance with your Phantom Wallet on open-source programs like X, as some users will pose as members of the wallet’s support staff and try to con you. For answers to your questions, consult Phantom’s own documentation and help files . If you still require assistance, visit their website for support. Keep in mind that no one from Phantom will ever request your private keys or seed phrase! 5. Zengo Wallet Zengo wallet app | Source: Zengo Multi-party computation (MPC) technology is used by the self-custodial Zengo wallet to protect user accounts. Since its launch in 2019, it has never been compromised and is built to be safe by default, protecting the assets of more than a million users. Face recognition, threshold key signatures, and three-factor authentication are some of Zengo’s security features. In addition to offering a recovery mechanism that eliminates the possibility of a single point of failure, the wallet’s MPC technology guarantees that the user’s funds are nearly impossible to hack. Perhaps best of all, the Zengo wallet is totally free and accessible on both iOS and Android! Although they do have a subscription service called Zengo Pro, most users will find Zengo Essentials, which is free, to be more than enough. In addition to tokens and NFTs on the ETH and Polygon ( POL ) networks, the Zengo wallet supports more than 1,000 assets, including majors like BTC, ETH, BNB, Dogecoin, Tezos, and stablecoins. Zengo may be used to purchase, sell, and exchange assets right from within the wallet in addition to being a good option for asset storage. You might also like: 5 non-custodial crypto wallets for a comfortable travel experience Conclusion: Choosing the right crypto wallet for your needs Understanding what is a wallet in cryptocurrency is crucial for managing your digital assets securely and efficiently. Whether you’re just starting your crypto journey or you’re an experienced investor, selecting the right wallet is essential to protect your assets. If you’re looking for a hardware wallet, devices like the Trezor wallet and Exodus wallet are highly regarded for their security features and ease of use. Trezor, for example, is considered one of the best crypto wallets for cold storage, providing offline protection of your private keys. On the other hand, Exodus wallet combines functionality with user-friendliness, allowing you to manage multiple cryptocurrencies with ease, and even stake assets for passive income. For those looking to explore the world of decentralized finance, a DeFi wallet such as Zengo wallet offers robust security features, including face recognition and MPC technology, ensuring your funds are safe. In conclusion, always ensure that your wallet of choice aligns with your investment strategy, provides the security features you need, and supports the cryptocurrencies you intend to use. Whether you’re looking for the best wallet for crypto or exploring the diverse world of DeFi wallets, the right tool can help you navigate the crypto landscape with confidence.

title: Unveiling Manus AI Premium: Subscription Plans & Mobile App Launch!
body: Exciting news in the world of AI! Manus AI , the China-based AI agent platform that took the internet by storm, has just announced the launch of its subscription plans and a dedicated mobile app . But is this move towards premium access a game-changer, or just another paywall? Let’s dive into what Manus AI is offering, and whether it lives up to the hype, especially for those in the crypto and tech-savvy community. What is Manus AI and Why Should You Care? For those unfamiliar, Manus AI is an AI agent platform designed to be your digital assistant on steroids. Imagine having an AI that can handle a wide range of tasks, from the mundane to the moderately complex. Need a website for your crypto project’s upcoming event? Manus AI claims it can do that. Want to automate your social media content schedule for your latest NFT drop? Manus AI aims to streamline those workflows. Manus AI’s appeal lies in its promise of agentic capabilities. But what does ‘agentic’ really mean in this context? Autonomous Task Execution: Unlike chatbots that simply respond to prompts, Manus AI is designed to independently carry out tasks from start to finish. Proactive Problem Solving: The platform aims to anticipate user needs and proactively offer solutions, rather than just reacting to commands. Learning and Adaptation: Manus AI is built to learn from interactions and improve its performance over time, becoming a more efficient and personalized tool. However, it’s crucial to remember that Manus AI is still in beta. While the marketing promises are bold, real-world performance is what truly matters. Our initial tests revealed that while impressive in some areas, the platform hasn’t fully delivered on all its ambitious claims. But with the introduction of subscription plans and a mobile app , is Manus AI taking a step closer to fulfilling its potential? Manus AI Subscription Plans: Premium Access or Premium Price Tag? Let’s talk about the money. Manus AI is moving beyond its free beta phase and introducing two subscription plans . Here’s a breakdown of what you get for your crypto (or fiat): Plan Price Credits Simultaneous Tasks Additional Perks Basic Premium $39/month 3,900 2 – Advanced Premium $199/month 19,900 5 Priority access during peak hours Both subscription plans operate on a credit system. Credits are essentially the currency within Manus AI , used to fuel your AI agent tasks. Need more credits? Top-up packs are available, though pricing details are still under wraps. For power users, the Advanced Premium plan offers a significant credit boost and the ability to run more tasks concurrently, which could be beneficial for complex projects or agencies managing multiple clients. Are These Plans Worth It? The value proposition of these subscription plans hinges on how effectively Manus AI can streamline your workflows and save you time. For crypto entrepreneurs, marketers, and developers constantly juggling multiple projects, a truly efficient AI agent platform could be a valuable asset. However, the $39 and $199 monthly price points are not insignificant, especially in the volatile crypto market. Users will need to carefully assess their needs and usage to determine if the ROI justifies the cost. Manus AI Goes Mobile: AI Agents in Your Pocket Alongside the subscription plans , Manus AI has launched its first mobile app for iOS devices. This is a significant step towards making AI agent platform accessible on the go. Imagine managing your AI tasks, checking on progress, or even initiating new projects directly from your smartphone. The mobile app promises to bring a new level of convenience and flexibility to Manus AI users. While an Android app is likely in the pipeline, the initial iOS launch caters to a significant portion of the mobile market. What Can You Do With the Mobile App? While specific details about the mobile app ‘s functionality are still emerging, we can expect core features like: Task Management: Monitor the status of running tasks, review completed tasks, and manage your task queue. Project Initiation: Start new AI agent tasks directly from your mobile app , whether it’s generating content, analyzing data, or automating social media posts. Account Management: Check your credit balance, manage your subscription plans , and access account settings. Notifications: Receive real-time updates on task progress, platform announcements, and important account information. The mobile app is a crucial move for Manus AI , aligning with the increasing demand for mobile-first solutions in the tech world. For crypto traders and enthusiasts who are constantly monitoring markets and managing digital assets on their phones, a mobile app for their AI agent platform is a welcome addition. Powering Up: Claude 3.7 Sonnet Integration In another significant upgrade, Manus AI has announced that it’s now powered by Anthropic’s Claude 3.7 Sonnet model. This is a notable advancement, as Claude 3.7 Sonnet is known for its enhanced performance in reasoning, coding, and creative content generation. By upgrading its backend AI model, Manus AI aims to deliver more accurate, efficient, and sophisticated results to its users. This upgrade suggests a commitment to continuous improvement and a focus on providing a cutting-edge AI agent platform . What Does Claude 3.7 Sonnet Mean for Users? The integration of Claude 3.7 Sonnet could translate to several benefits for Manus AI users: Improved Task Accuracy: Expect more precise and reliable results from your AI agent tasks, thanks to Claude 3.7 Sonnet ‘s enhanced reasoning capabilities. Faster Processing: Claude 3.7 Sonnet is designed for speed and efficiency, potentially leading to quicker task completion times. Enhanced Creativity: For tasks involving content generation or creative problem-solving, Claude 3.7 Sonnet ‘s advanced language model could unlock new possibilities. Better Code Generation: If you’re using Manus AI for coding-related tasks, Claude 3.7 Sonnet ‘s improved coding abilities could be a significant advantage. The move to Claude 3.7 Sonnet signals Manus AI ‘s intention to stay at the forefront of AI agent platform technology, continuously enhancing its capabilities and user experience. Challenges and the Road Ahead Despite these exciting developments, Manus AI is still navigating the challenges of scaling and meeting user demand. As stated in their recent X post, they are temporarily limiting access to manage infrastructure growth and optimize usage rates. This suggests that while the platform is rapidly evolving, it’s still working through growing pains. Potential users should be aware of possible access limitations during peak hours, especially in the initial rollout of the subscription plans and mobile app . Final Thoughts: Is Manus AI Premium Worth the Investment? Manus AI ‘s launch of subscription plans , a mobile app , and the Claude 3.7 Sonnet upgrade mark a significant evolution for this AI agent platform . The move to premium access signals a shift towards a sustainable business model and a commitment to providing enhanced features and performance. For crypto professionals and tech enthusiasts seeking to leverage AI for automation and efficiency, Manus AI presents an intriguing option. However, potential subscribers should carefully weigh the cost against their anticipated usage and needs, especially considering the platform is still in beta and working through scaling challenges. The true test will be in how effectively Manus AI delivers on its promises and adapts to user feedback in this new premium era. To learn more about the latest AI Agent Platform trends, explore our article on key developments shaping AI features .

title: Investors hope for clarity on tariffs after Q1 downturns
body: This is a segment from the Forward Guidance newsletter. To read full editions, subscribe . In a fitting end to a rocky first quarter, US stocks fell back into correction territory Monday. The S&P 500 was trading 0.2% lower at 2 pm ET, putting it around 4.8% in the red since the start of 2025. The tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite is slated to close out Q1 almost 12% lower. It’s the worst first quarter performance for the Nasdaq Composite since 2020. One silver lining in Q1: gold. The precious metal is about to notch its best-performing quarter since 1986. Analysts attribute the rally to the Trump tariff-induced trade war. (More on that later.) Digital gold, though, is a different story. Bitcoin is slated to close out its worst Q1 since 2018. The narrative of bitcoin as a safe-haven asset , apparently, has not taken. Looking ahead, things could get worse before they get better. Tariffs are set to remain a dominant market narrative in Q2. President Trump is slated to announce his global tariff plans on Wednesday, which he’s dubbed “Liberation Day.” To Team Trump, April 2 will mark a turning point for domestic manufacturing. To some analysts, “Liberation Day” could also bring salvation to US equity prices (at least in the short term). The logic goes: If Trump announces a comprehensive reciprocal tariff regime, investors will gain clarity. Hopefully the daily headlines will slow down and markets can stop wondering whether a levy will be delayed or amended. Concrete answers on the tariff front would leave investors free to focus on impacts of other Trump administration economic policies, like tax cuts. In the long term, I’m less optimistic. Even Trump’s closest Cabinet members reportedly aren’t fully up-to-speed on what the president will say on Wednesday, so I’d imagine markets will also be shocked. If the announcements lead to a significant escalation in the trade war, any “clarity” bump will quickly be reversed. I’d also argue that these reciprocal tariffs are not priced-in, so expect some short-term volatility later in the week as investors digest the announcements from the White House. OK, I’m putting the crystal ball down now. Keep an eye on your inbox later this week to see how my predictions hold up. Get the news in your inbox. Explore Blockworks newsletters: Blockworks Daily : The newsletter that helps thousands of investors understand crypto and the markets, by Byron Gilliam. title: PumpSwap DEX Surges to $10 Billion in Volume in 10 Days, Capturing 67.4% of Solana Market with $2.43B Trading Volume
body: PumpSwap, a decentralized exchange (DEX) launched by Pumpfun, has quickly established itself as a dominant player in the Solana ecosystem. Within just ten days of its launch on March 20, 2025, PumpSwap processed over $10 billion in cumulative trading volume, according to data from Dune Analytics. On March 30, it achieved a remarkable $2.43 billion in trading volume, capturing 67.4% of the total volume processed by major Solana DEXs, significantly outpacing Raydium, which accounted for 18.2%. The rapid growth of PumpSwap reflects a shift in the Solana DEX landscape, as it has become the largest fee generator on the platform. The exchange has also attracted a substantial user base, boasting approximately 700,000 active wallets and facilitating over 30 million swaps in its first ten days. This surge in activity comes amid a decline in overall Solana DEX activity, indicating a competitive environment for liquidity among decentralized exchanges. title: Bybit Unleashes 25x Leverage on New GUN/USDT Perpetual Contract: A Trader’s Guide
body: Exciting news for cryptocurrency traders! Bybit, a leading global cryptocurrency exchange, has just announced the launch of its brand new GUN/USDT perpetual contract . This addition opens up fresh opportunities for traders looking to engage with digital assets and amplify their trading strategies with up to 25x leverage. Let’s dive into what this means for you and how you can potentially benefit from this new offering on Bybit . What’s New? Bybit Launches GUN/USDT Perpetual Contract In a move that is sure to excite the crypto community, Bybit has officially listed the GUN/USDT perpetual contract. This announcement, made on their official website, signifies Bybit’s commitment to expanding its range of trading instruments and catering to the diverse needs of its global user base. But what exactly does this mean for traders, and why should you pay attention? Here’s a quick rundown of the key highlights: New Trading Pair: GUN/USDT perpetual contract is now available on Bybit. Up to 25x Leverage: Traders can access leverage of up to 25 times their initial margin. Perpetual Contract: Unlike traditional futures, this contract has no expiry date, allowing for continuous trading. Increased Opportunities: Opens doors for traders to speculate on the price of GUN against USDT with leverage. This launch is particularly noteworthy as it adds another altcoin to Bybit’s growing list of perpetual contracts. As the cryptocurrency trading landscape evolves, exchanges like Bybit are constantly seeking to provide traders with more options and tools to navigate the market. Understanding Perpetual Contracts: A Quick Primer For those new to the world of crypto derivatives, understanding what a perpetual contract is crucial. Unlike traditional futures contracts that have an expiry date, a perpetual contract , as the name suggests, has no expiration. It mimics a spot market but with the added benefit of leverage. This makes it a popular tool for traders looking to hold positions for varying lengths of time without the hassle of contract rollovers. Key features of perpetual contracts include: No Expiration Date: Trade indefinitely without worrying about contract expiry. Mark Price: Uses a ‘Mark Price’ system to prevent unnecessary liquidations due to market manipulation or thin order books. Funding Rate: A periodic payment either to or from traders based on the difference between the perpetual contract market and the spot market. This mechanism helps to keep the perpetual contract price anchored to the spot price. Leverage: Allows traders to control larger positions with a smaller amount of capital. The introduction of the GUN/USDT perpetual contract means traders can now apply these features to speculate on the price movements of GUN token against USDT, all within the robust and user-friendly environment of Bybit . What is GUN Token? Exploring the Underlying Asset Now that we know about the new contract, let’s understand the underlying asset: GUN token. While the announcement focuses on the trading instrument, it’s important to have some context about what GUN token represents. Understanding the asset you’re trading is crucial for informed cryptocurrency trading decisions. Unfortunately, the provided content doesn’t give details about GUN token itself. To make an informed trading decision, you would typically research: Project Goals: What problem does the GUN token project aim to solve? What is its utility? Tokenomics: What is the total supply, distribution, and token utility? Market Cap and Volume: How liquid is the token? What is its market capitalization? Community and Development: Is there an active community and development team behind the project? Whitepaper and Roadmap: Review the project’s whitepaper and roadmap for future plans. Before trading the GUN/USDT perpetual contract, it’s highly recommended to conduct thorough research on GUN token to understand its fundamentals and potential risks. Remember, informed trading is responsible trading. Leverage Trading Explained: Amplifying Opportunities (and Risks) The headline feature of this announcement is the 25x leverage offered on the GUN/USDT perpetual contract. Leverage trading can be a powerful tool, but it’s essential to understand how it works and the associated risks. What is Leverage? Leverage allows you to control a larger position in the market with a smaller amount of your own capital. In the case of 25x leverage, for every $1 of your capital, you can control $25 worth of GUN/USDT. This can amplify both your potential profits and losses. Benefits of Leverage: Magnified Profits: If the price of GUN moves in your favor, your profits are multiplied by the leverage ratio. Capital Efficiency: You can control larger positions without tying up a significant amount of capital. Diversification Opportunities: Leverage can free up capital for other trading opportunities. Risks of Leverage: Magnified Losses: Just as profits are amplified, so are losses. A small adverse price movement can lead to significant losses, potentially exceeding your initial margin. Liquidation Risk: If the market moves against your position and your margin balance falls below the maintenance margin level, your position may be liquidated, resulting in the loss of your initial margin. Increased Volatility Impact: Volatile assets like cryptocurrencies can experience rapid price swings, which can be particularly risky when using high leverage. Example of 25x Leverage: Let’s say you have $100 and you use 25x leverage to trade GUN/USDT. Position Size: You control a position worth $2500 (25 x $100). Scenario 1 (Profit): If GUN/USDT price increases by 1%, your profit would be $25 (1% of $2500), which is a 25% return on your initial $100 capital. Scenario 2 (Loss): If GUN/USDT price decreases by 1%, your loss would be $25 (1% of $2500), which is a 25% loss on your initial $100 capital. As you can see, leverage trading can significantly amplify both gains and losses. It’s crucial to use leverage responsibly and implement robust risk management strategies. Why Trade GUN/USDT Perpetual Contract on Bybit? Bybit has established itself as a reputable and popular platform for cryptocurrency trading , particularly for derivatives. Choosing the right exchange is as important as choosing the right trading instrument. Here are some reasons why traders might consider using Bybit for trading the GUN/USDT perpetual contract: User-Friendly Platform: Bybit is known for its intuitive and easy-to-navigate trading platform, suitable for both beginners and experienced traders. Robust Trading Engine: Bybit boasts a powerful trading engine capable of handling high volumes and order execution speeds, crucial in volatile crypto markets. Competitive Fees: Bybit offers competitive trading fees, which can be an important factor, especially for active traders. Strong Security Measures: Bybit prioritizes security and employs various measures to protect user funds and data. 24/7 Customer Support: Access to round-the-clock customer support can be invaluable, especially in the fast-paced world of crypto trading. Variety of Trading Tools: Bybit provides a range of trading tools and features, including advanced order types, charting tools, and educational resources. By choosing Bybit , traders gain access to a platform designed for efficient and secure cryptocurrency trading , enhancing their experience with the new GUN/USDT perpetual contract. Navigating the Risks: Essential Considerations for Trading GUN/USDT While the potential rewards of trading the GUN/USDT perpetual contract with leverage are enticing, it’s imperative to be fully aware of the risks involved. Responsible cryptocurrency trading always starts with understanding and managing risk. Key Risks to Consider: Market Volatility: The cryptocurrency market is inherently volatile. GUN token, like many altcoins, can experience significant price fluctuations, increasing the risk of liquidation, especially when using leverage. Liquidation Risk (High Leverage): Trading with 25x leverage significantly increases the risk of liquidation. Even small adverse price movements can trigger liquidation if risk management is not properly implemented. GUN Token Specific Risks: As an altcoin, GUN token may have lower liquidity and be more susceptible to market manipulation compared to more established cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin or Ethereum. Thorough research on GUN token is crucial. Funding Rate Fluctuations: While the funding rate mechanism aims to keep the perpetual contract price aligned with the spot price, fluctuations in funding rates can impact your profitability, especially for longer-term positions. Complexity of Derivatives: Trading perpetual contracts and using leverage requires a good understanding of these instruments and their mechanics. It’s not recommended for novice traders without proper education. Risk Management Strategies: Start with Lower Leverage: If you are new to leverage trading, consider starting with lower leverage ratios and gradually increase as you gain experience and confidence. Use Stop-Loss Orders: Always use stop-loss orders to limit potential losses. Determine a comfortable risk level and set stop-loss orders accordingly. Manage Your Position Size: Do not risk a significant portion of your capital on a single trade. Proper position sizing is crucial for managing risk. Educate Yourself: Continuously learn about cryptocurrency trading , technical analysis, risk management, and the specific characteristics of GUN token and perpetual contracts. Trade with Capital You Can Afford to Lose: Never trade with funds you cannot afford to lose. Cryptocurrency trading, especially with leverage, involves significant risk of capital loss. Actionable Insights: Getting Started with GUN/USDT Perpetual Contract Ready to explore the new GUN/USDT perpetual contract on Bybit ? Here are some actionable insights to help you get started: Research GUN Token: Before trading, conduct thorough research on GUN token. Understand its fundamentals, use cases, and market dynamics. Understand Perpetual Contracts and Leverage: Ensure you have a solid understanding of how perpetual contracts and leverage work. Practice with smaller positions or paper trading if you are new. Develop a Trading Strategy: Don’t trade impulsively. Develop a clear trading strategy that includes entry and exit points, risk management rules, and position sizing. Start Small: Begin with small positions, especially when using leverage. Gradually increase your position size as you gain experience and confidence. Monitor Your Trades: Keep a close eye on your open positions. Cryptocurrency markets can move quickly, and active monitoring is essential. Utilize Bybit’s Resources: Explore Bybit’s educational resources, trading tools, and customer support to enhance your trading experience. By taking a cautious and informed approach, you can explore the potential opportunities presented by the GUN/USDT perpetual contract on Bybit while mitigating the inherent risks of leverage trading . Conclusion: Embrace New Opportunities in Crypto Derivatives Bybit’s addition of the GUN/USDT perpetual contract with up to 25x leverage marks another step forward in the evolution of cryptocurrency trading . It provides traders with increased opportunities to engage with digital assets and utilize sophisticated trading instruments to potentially enhance their portfolio performance. However, it is crucial to remember that with increased opportunity comes increased risk. Leverage trading is not for the faint of heart and requires a thorough understanding of market dynamics, risk management, and the specific asset being traded. As the cryptocurrency trading landscape continues to mature, platforms like Bybit play a vital role in offering innovative tools and instruments. For traders who are well-prepared, disciplined, and risk-aware, the GUN/USDT perpetual contract could be a valuable addition to their trading toolkit. Always prioritize education, responsible trading practices, and never invest more than you can afford to lose. The world of crypto derivatives is dynamic and potentially rewarding, but it demands respect and a cautious approach. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action.

title: Bitcoin whale accumulation trend mirrors 2020-era bullish activity after BTC price bounces off $81K
body: Bitcoin (BTC) price dipped below its ascending channel pattern over the weekend, dropping to $81,222 on March 31. The top cryptocurrency is set to register its worst quarterly return since 2018, but a group of whale entities are mirroring a 2020-era bull run signal. Bitcoin 1-day chart. Source: Cointelegraph/TradingView In a recent quick take post, onchain analyst Mignolet explained that “market-leading” whale addresses holding between 1,000 to 10,000 BTC exhibited a high correlation with Bitcoin price. The analyst said that these entities are resilient to market volatility and show accumulation behavior, mirroring patterns of the 2020 bull cycle. Bitcoin whale accumulation analysis. Source: CryptoQuant In the current bull market, this distinct pattern emerged three times and is marked by Bitcoin whales’ rapid BTC accumulation, even as retail investors doubted a positive directional bias. These periods were riddled with bearish market sentiment and preceded substantial price surges, suggesting that whales were positioning themselves ahead of the recovery. While BTC currently exhibited a price decline, the analyst said, “There are no signs yet that the market-leading whales are exiting.” As shown in the chart above, “Pattern No. 3” witnessed a similar rate of accumulation, but BTC price remained sideways. Related: Bitcoin trader issues’ overbought' warning as BTC price eyes $84K Can Bitcoin flip $84,000 after the CME gap? As the New York trading session started on March 31, BTC rallied to close the CME futures gap that formed over the weekend. The CME gap highlights the difference between the closing price of the BTC futures on Friday and the opening price on Sunday evening. Bitcoin CME gap analysis. Source: Cointelegraph/TradingView While Bitcoin started this week out on a bullish tip, there are a handful of US economic events that could have an impact on the price. April. 1, JOLTS Job Openings: A metric reflecting labor market demand; a decline might signal weakness. April 2, US tariff rollout: termed “Liberation Day,” with 20% and larger tariffs coming on for up to 25 countries. April 4, Non-farm payrolls (NFP), Unemployment rate and Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell’s speech. Bitcoin 4-hour chart. Source: Cointelegraph/TradingView BTC’s immediate point of interest is to flip the $84,000 level into support for a bullish continuation. Reclaiming $84,000 could push BTC prices above the 50-day exponential moving average, which might bolster a short-term rally to the supply zone between $86,700 and $88,700. On the contrary, prolonged consolidation under $84,000 strengthens its resistance characteristics, which might eventually lead to further corrections to downside liquidity areas in the $78,200 to $76,560 zone. Related: Bitcoin’s ‘digital gold’ claim challenged as traders move into bonds and gold hits new highs This article does not contain investment advice or recommendations. Every investment and trading move involves risk, and readers should conduct their own research when making a decision.

title: Will Crypto Market Decline Persist As China, Japan, South Korea Respond To US Tariffs?
body: As the US prepares to implement new tariffs, the crypto market is seeing increased volatility. Recent developments involving China, Japan, and South Korea may further contribute to market uncertainty. The three countries have agreed to respond jointly to the tariffs, raising questions about how global trade tensions will affect the crypto market. With President Trump’s planned “Liberation Day” tariffs on the horizon, questions loom over the future of Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies. U.S. Tariffs and Global Trade Tensions China, Japan, and South Korea have reportedly confirmed that they would cooperate in addressing the U.S. tariffs, which are set to be introduced in early April. The tariffs target multiple industries, including the automotive and pharmaceutical sectors. This move comes on the back of US threats to impose additional tariffs which President Donald Trump has termed as ‘Liberation Day,’ set to happen on April 2, Wednesday. Moreover, these three nations America’s important trading partners, and these tariffs can affect the stability of their economic sectors. Such cooperation indicates that they have formed strategic alliances in order to safeguard their export destinations and economic advantages. The announcement comes in the wake of the trade ministers of the three countries meeting in a bid to intensify cooperation hence reducing the effects of the policies of the United States of America. However, tensions on the trade issue may even escalate further, and the odds of a trade war are still looming over the crypto market . These developments have led to alerts over various global financial markets, especially due to increasing integration of the national and global stages for business, especially in the crypto market. Bitcoin Price Analysis Amid Tariff Concerns The crypto market has already shown signs of distress, with Bitcoin experiencing a noticeable decline. As of March 31, Bitcoin was trading at $82,687, down nearly 2% in a 24-hour period. The cryptocurrency has faced a series of lower lows, with the most recent drop continuing a bearish trend. Bitcoin’s price has struggled to maintain its momentum, and the market has responded cautiously to global economic news. Overall, the activities in the US market play a key role for the Bitcoin price decrease. The US being close to ‘Liberation Day’ on April 2 when new tariffs are anticipated to be implemented, traders are preparing themselves for increased fluctuation in the crypto market. These aspects, including the future of global trade and uncertainty around what the US policies would be like for the world economy, has given investors more reason to pause. Bitcoin, in particular, has been caught in this downward spiral, with its price showing weaker momentum. Bitcoin’s recent price movement reflects a broader risk-off sentiment, with traders reducing exposure to more volatile assets. While Bitcoin was able to recover slightly after four consecutive days of decline, the overall sentiment remains bearish. Bitcoin has not managed to break past key resistance levels, and the possibility of further downward pressure remains high. Institutional Interest and Long-Term Outlook Despite the short-term declines in Bitcoin’s price, institutional interest in the cryptocurrency remains strong. On-chain data analyzed by Glassnode reveals that the number of addresses containing from 1000 to 10000 BTC has also been slowly rising, indicating that institutional investors are still active in the market. This acquisition by institutional investors shows that investors are increasing their holdings of Bitcoin in the long-term despite short-term downturns. At the same time, the Fear & Greed Index is still in the “fear” territory, which means that traders are concern about long-term impact of the tariffs. Bitcoin Fear and Greed Index is 34. Fear Current price: $82,687 pic.twitter.com/wDyPuGshJG — Bitcoin Fear and Greed Index (@BitcoinFear) March 31, 2025 Similarly, XRP and Cardano (ADA) alongside Solana (SOL), Dogecoin (DOGE), and Ethereum (ETH) have been on the decline due to the general bearish crypto market. Additionally, Bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs) have shown sustained inflows, highlighting that there is still demand for Bitcoin from institutional traders. This ongoing interest from large investors contrasts with the risk-off sentiment observed in the broader market. However, analysts remain cautious, as the tariffs and economic uncertainty could keep Bitcoin’s price rangebound in the short term. Bitcoin’s Price Resistance Should Crypto Market Decline Persist Bitcoin price has reached important support and resistance zones, and analysts like Rekt Capital are also considering these levels crucial. For the moment, Bitcoin is hovering slightly above the $82000 level. The immediate target on the upside is found at $85,000 which has offered a major resistance to Bitcoin in the past few days. If the Bitcoin price can get through this level and establish an upward movement, then there could be some kind of a bounce back. However, if the tariffs result in further economic instability, Bitcoin may struggle to maintain its price levels. Some analysts suggest that Bitcoin could experience a V-shaped recovery if the market stabilizes. On the other hand, if the bearish trend continues, Bitcoin price could see further declines, potentially testing lower support levels around $70,000 or even below, depending on the market’s reaction to the tariffs and global trade tensions. The post Will Crypto Market Decline Persist As China, Japan, South Korea Respond To US Tariffs? appeared first on CoinGape .
